Articles.Content:
Hey guys! I need some help.

My KSP, earlier today, seems to have died this afternoon. Basically when a went to open it up, like you do, it just shows me the windows loading cursor and never opened. The only way to make it start loading is to launch it from the launcher, and then it loads fine. But when I try to load any craft... It is frozen in space, all the RCS thrusters are firing and things are generally broken to the point I'm worried about my save being corrupt (but I have no idea how to figure if it is).

 

I tried to fix KSP by running the patcher multiple times, and it doesn't seem to do anything. I tried to overwrite all the stock game files with a clean KSP directory and it didn't work at all, either. Any help is really appreciated, since this is my 2nd carrer save in the span of a week, although the first one was due to a corrupt save, on a different KSP install.

 

Here's a picture of my Mun ship bugging out:

I'm trying the patcher as I write this, so if it gets fixed I'll just change this to 'Answered'.

 

EDIT: Yep, patcher did nothing.

Edited June 19, 2016 by Pine
About 80 of them, but I tried removing all of them and it still bugged everything on a new save.

13 hours ago, Pine said:

I tried to fix KSP by running the patcher multiple times, and it doesn't seem to do anything. I tried to overwrite all the stock game files with a clean KSP directory and it didn't work at all, either.

The patcher still has problems, don't use it. Instead, try downloading a fresh copy of the game (don't overwrite the old stuff, make a new, fresh install), then reinstall your mods into the fresh game and copy your save files over.
I though the patcher was fixed in the last update, but oh well. I'll try to download a fresh copy and reinstall the mods as soon as I get to my computer. Hope it works!
